intro: Verbascum chaixii subsp. laxum, commonly known as the laxum mullein, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Verbascum, which is part of the family Scrophulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. This subspecies is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
